introduction: Follow the efforts of one man -Lee Eng Kew, a.k.a. Ah Kew, freelance writer and field historian as he explores temples and grave yards to archive epitaphs, trace lineage and record oral history. For over ten years, this man in the street has carried out extensive research on the illustrious history of Taiping, a town of many firsts in Perak, Malaysia - focusing on the Chinese immigration and contributions to the town and state.
